dmca.title: Blogger DMCA Complaint- Washington Post
dmca.body:
Washingtonpost.Newsweek Interactive

January 26, 2007

VIA DHL

Google, Inc.
Attn: Blogger Legal Support, DMCA Complaints
1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy
Mountain View, CA 94043

RE: Copyright Infringement Notice

Dear Copyright Manager:

Here are the required sections according to your email on 1/23/07:

1) The copyright work which is being infringed can be seen here: http://www.slate.com/id/2154621/. It is an article written by the editor of slate.com which first appeared on the site on 11/29/06. The name of the article is "NATO to the Rescue," written by Jacob Weisberg.

2) The material which is infringing on the copyrighted work listed above in #1 is available at this site: http://opaherbey.blogspot.com/2006/11/two-views-on-iraq.html. (permalink)

3) Contact information is permissions@washingtonpost.com (Washingtonpost.Newsweek Interactive owns both washingtonpost.com and slate.com)

4) I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

5) I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

Sincerely,

Sherrese M. Smith
Deputy General Counsel
Washingtonpost.Newsweek Interactive
1515 North Courthouse Rd.
Arlington, VA 22201
Email: Sherrese.Smith@wpm.com
SMS/ds
